decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents: 3287-CB-A-DR-0001 (Site Location Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0009 (Existing Block Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0010 (Existing Ground Floor Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0011 (Existing First Floor Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0051 (Existing North East Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0052 (Existing South East Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0053 (Existing South West Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0054 (Existing North West Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0109 (Proposed Block Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0110 Rev B (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0111 Rev A (Proposed First Floor Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0112 Rev A (Proposed Second Floor Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0113 Rev A (Proposed Third Floor Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0114 (Proposed Roof Plan); 3287-CB-A-DR-0150 (Proposed Front Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0151 Rev A (Proposed Flats North East Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0152 Rev A (Proposed Flats South East Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0153 (Proposed Flats South West Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0154 Rev A (Proposed Flats North West Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0155 (Proposed Houses North East Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0156 (Proposed Houses South East Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0157 (Proposed Houses South West Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0158 (Proposed Houses North West Elevation); 3287-CB-A-DR-0170 (Proposed Section A-A); 3287-CB-A-DR-0171 (Proposed Section B-B); Daylight and Sunlight Report prepared by Schroeders Begg dated September 2021; Fire Strategy Outline prepared by Cove Burgess dated October 2021; Design and Access Statement prepared by Cove Burgess dated September 2021; Transport Statement prepared by Markides Associates dated 5 October 2021
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the hereby approved development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced except for demolition or ground works. The details shall be fully implemented as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the Ealing Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).

| A minimum of twelve (12) cycle storage spaces for the flats and two (2) cycle storage spaces for each of the terraced houses shall be provided on site in accordance with the locations identified within the drawings and documents listed under condition 2. The cycle storage areas shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and retained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (Housing) (2012).

| A minimum of 1no. 1100L refuse and 1no. 1100L recycling bins shall be provided on site for the  flats and a minimum of 1no. 360L refuse and 1no. 360L recycling bins shall be provided for each of the terraced houses in accordance with the locations identified within the drawings and documents listed under condition 2. The refuse store shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and retained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To provide waste storage facilities, in accordance with policy SI8 of the London Plan (2021) and SPG4 Refuse and Recycling Facilities.

| All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by dust, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D13 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG).

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses, namely, kitchen/living/dining room adjoining/below bedroom of separate dwelling and adjoining the communal main entrance, should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing interim SPG10.

| Prior to commencement of the development, a demolition method statement/ construction management plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include control measures for:-
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- delivery locations,
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| At least one ground floor unit shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Part M4(2) (Accessible and adaptable dwellings) or other such relevant technical requirements in use at the time of the construction of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policies D5, D6 and D7 of the London Plan (2021); and policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012).

| The (northwest and southeast) side facing windows on the houses and flats (except for those at ground floor level) shall be obscure glazed non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved (excluding site setup, demolition, site clearance or ground works), further details of the proposed energy source for heating and hot water shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The energy proposal shall demonstrate the use of the Best Available Technology at the time of construction of the development. Where boilers are proposed, details should demonstrate that they would not worsen existing air quality for occupants and neighbouring residents and that its N0x output would be under 0.030 g/kWh. The plant shall be installed in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interests of air quality and amenity in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD(2013) and policy SI1 of the London Plan(2021) and the Mayor's Best Practice Guidance for Using Green Infrastructure to Protect People from Air Pollution(2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2016 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7B and Local variation to policy 7.4 Local Character of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7B and Local variation to policy 7.4 Local Character of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Construction of a 4 storey building comprising 6 residential flats and three, 3 storey, terraced residential dwellings and associated private amenity areas, car and cycle parking, landscaping, refuse storage and associated works (Total 9 self-contained residential units). (Following demolition of existing building)
